snippet: The State Supreme Court ruled Monday that state corrections officials cannot prohibit all registered sex offenders from living within 2,000 feet of a school or park as required by a 2006 voter-approved ballot measure.
abstract: California State Supreme Court rules state corrections officials cannot prohibit all registered sex offenders from living within 2,000 feet of a school or park as required by a 2006 voter-approved ballot measure.
lead_paragraph: The State Supreme Court ruled Monday that state corrections officials cannot prohibit all registered sex offenders from living within 2,000 feet of a school or park as required by a 2006 voter-approved ballot measure.

headline.main: California: Housing Restrictions Overturned for Sex Offenders
headline.print_headline: California: Housing Restrictions Overturned for Sex Offenders
